citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Correlations of the Monthly Precipitation and Temperature with 500 mb Heights for the Northern Hemisphere (pub. 1963)

abstract.p: Publication Title: Tables of the correlation coefficient between the monthly total precipitation and the monthly mean height anomaly of 500 mb over the Northern Hemisphere. Sheet of title and subtitle translations inserted.

Pt. 2. Simultaneous and lag correlation between the cubic root of monthly total precipitation in Japan and the monthly mean height anomaly of 500 mb over the Northern Hemisphere -- pt. 3. Simultaneous correlation tables between the cubic root of monthly total precipitation in Japan and the zonal mean of 500 mb height, and the zonal index -- pt. 4. Simultaneous correlation tables between the monthly mean temperature in Japan and the zonal mean of 500 mb height, and the zonal index -- pt. 5. Tables of standard deviation of monthly mean 500 mb height over the Northern Hemisphere.
Available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
